column1: Jhn was born in Morgenrthe-Rautenkranz, in the Vogtland district of Saxony, Germany.
From 1943 to 1951 he attended school in his hometown, and after school trained as a printer.
In 1955 he joined the East German Air Force, where he became a pilot and military scientist.

column2: Jhn was awarded the title Hero of the Soviet Union on 3 September 1978.

column1: In 1983 he received a doctorate in physics at the "Zentralinstitut fr Physik der Erde" in Potsdam, specialising in remote sensing of the earth.

column2: In 2002 he finally retired from this job.
Jhn is married and has two children.

column1: He lives in Strausberg and he enjoys reading and hunting.
In 1976, Jhn was selected with his backup Eberhard Kllner for the Interkosmos programme.
He spent 7 days, 20 hours, and 49 minutes in space.
